author: Anonymous Scale
title: templates: backtracking or try-catch
question: I've seen in some practice solutions where the template has "backtracking" instead of "try-catch". Is there a difference? Are they interchangeable or are there specific instances where we use one over the other?
instructor_answer:
backtracking was always naming the wrong thing, in a way that caused real confusion later in the course.  so we renamed it to try-catch.
At this point in the course I think the only difference would be that if you had, for example, a backtracking search over an arb-arity tree, with both functions defined at top-level, now we only put try-catch on the (listof X) function.
